website_summaries.verdict: The La Sportiva Wildcat 2.0 GTX is a waterproof trail running shoe that is very reliable when used in snowy surface. The updated version provides enhanced stability, cushioning and comfort. It is a great partner for daily running activity. Given the positive and negative comments from the users, the Wildcat 2.0 GTX still needs a few improvements.
pros: It features a one-piece mesh upper for added comfort and excellent adaptability, according to a few reviews
Majority of the runners applauded the sturdy construction of the La Sportiva Wildcat 2.0 GTX
Most runners were impressed by the grip of this shoe when used in snowy and icy terrain
The waterproof membrane really works impressively as noted in some reviews
cons: The Wildcat 2.0 GTX has a narrow construction and not ideal for runners with wider foot
Some runners observed that underfoot cushioning needs improvement
Few runners found this shoe a bit heavy

customer_reviews.title: LASPORTIVA SIZES THESE SMALLER
customer_reviews.text: Be aware! I usually wear a size 8 1⁄2 or 9. These are size 9 1⁄2 and a perfect fit. Other reveries have said the same thing so buy a 1⁄2 - 1 size larger than you wear. This is my 3rd pair and there's good reason for that. They wear well, have great balance and I am still wearing my second pair, I just bought these because it looks like they are discontinuing the blue/black color. They have lasted a lot longer than other similar shoes I've bought and I'm frikkin' HARD on trail runners! Excellent purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Sewell

customer_reviews.title: Very nice shoe - order a size larger than normal
customer_reviews.text: From the day I got these shoes I have been in the rain and walking thru dew laden grass. Very water proof. Very comfortable shoe also. This is a trail running shoe, so foot impacts on the ground are not as soft as a full blown running shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Tread wore well and generally the grip was excellent. They dried quicker than the 3
customer_reviews.text: Wore on AT and got about 400 - 500 miles per pair. They would first wear out at the toe box crease which was not surprising. Tread wore well and generally the grip was excellent. They dried quicker than the 3.0 or raptors. Best part, not one blister. Period! Nuff said!!
customer_reviews.author: djMA

customer_reviews.title: Check Sizing
customer_reviews.text: Good, comfortable shoe however sizing is smaller than we typically experience. I ultimately purchased one size larger than my normal size and I think it is going to work great.
customer_reviews.author: WB2

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe. I never thought I'd pay this much ...
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe. I never thought I'd pay this much for a running shoe again, but I owned a prior version I bought on sale and liked them so much I wanted another pair when the others wore out. These shoes have a lot of cushion for a trail shoe. They are waterproof, the soles are sticky, and the tread grips incredibly well. The lacing pattern seems overly complicated
customer_reviews.author: orangerock

customer_reviews.title: Supination pain mostly gone
customer_reviews.text: I have arch pain from supination (walking on outside of foot with fairly high arches) these are best shoes I've found so far for daily 3-5 mile walks. Tried many shoes and supports - these are great right out of box and waterproofing very good too. Sizing runs small.
customer_reviews.author: mcp0427

customer_reviews.title: Offroad runners
customer_reviews.text: La Sportiva's shoes just fit my feet for some reason, their last must look familiar. I've only had two pairs of their shoes, so my review is not extensive, but so far I've found their shoes to be technically brilliant. Not very light, but a decent amount of motion control and lots of padding, great traction. A high-performance off-road shoe, but not a racer by any means. My feet are pretty narrow and I had to get a half size larger than usual.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended to buy online
customer_reviews.text: Size doesn't fit as per standards, so very much disappointed with the product and couldn't use even single time though. I wont recommend this product buying online.
customer_reviews.author: Deepak Shankar

customer_reviews.title: Runs small
customer_reviews.text: Normally wear a size 9, size 9 is very tight in toe box and big toe hits front of shoe when going downhill, tried size 9.5 and was too big. Lightweight and look good. Just can’t get a size that fits
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Know your size!
customer_reviews.text: 42.5 is too small. I was told that is comparable to 9.5. It is too tight! I have another pr. that I bought at 43 and it fits much better!
customer_reviews.author: PJ Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: very narrow in the arch and very wide in the sole makes my foot go to sleep
customer_reviews.author: R. Moulton-Barrett

customer_reviews.title: Looks good but questionable performance
customer_reviews.text: Not a good one for support and balance on rocky trails is minimum
customer_reviews.author: SHERIEF ELABD

customer_reviews.title: I will get m same one one size bigger. ...
customer_reviews.text: I will get m same one one size bigger...so I need money beck to my account soon as possible
customer_reviews.author: won yoo

customer_reviews.title: Mismatched upper and sole
customer_reviews.text: Took this on a 20 mile run/hike. Traction and cushioning were fine going up hill. Going down hill was terrible. The reason is that the upper is very soft and pliable, while the sole is very stiff. As a result, the upper does not prevent your foot from shifting forward and slamming into the toe box on steep downhills. I had to return them.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Aniello

customer_reviews.title: Too Small, Stiff, Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: I have worn LaSportiva hiking and trail shoes for over ten years. Several different models. All with comfort and great waterproof performance (GoreTex) -- except for this pair. I thought it might be because it needed a longer break-in period, or different socks, or different terrain. These shoes are too small, and I ordered the same size I have used in all previous LaSportiva products. Now, given that I have exceeded the 30-day return period, I cannot get credit for the $155 I shelled out. Well you have screwed me as a customer, and I shall NEVER buy LaSportiva footwear again. I guess someone at Goodwill with smaller feet will see if these work for them.
customer_reviews.author: Pennsylvania Consumer

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING SHOE!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes and right out of the gate they fit perfect. went on my trail runs and man I cant say enough good things. the traction is on point, the comfort is awesome and I still have not had any blisters. Out of the box they felt like I had been wearing them for years.
customer_reviews.author: Pm tebedo

customer_reviews.title: These are my all time favorite shoe. The gore tex is waterproof as advertised
customer_reviews.text: These are my all time favorite shoe. The gore tex is waterproof as advertised. I wore them in 6 inches of snow with no problem. I am going to be reordering this exact shoe soon. I am a minimalist runner and extreme trail runner. My la sportivas survived a spartan beast and Spartan super race. These shoes are well worth the money. I recommend them to anyone who trail runs or who spends hrs on their feet. 👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻
customer_reviews.author: patrick carey

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: problem during the walking; I have experience with La sportiva shirs covered with grid. If the grid opened a little, impossible to stop process
customer_reviews.author: Levan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoe but only lasted 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I gotta say this is the best traction shoe Ive ever had. I love to run steep mtns, and these gave me top notch stability bombing downhills. I used these in the snow as well and they tracked amazingly up and downhill. After 5-6 months of use and abuse they are toast. Soul is (seriously) half gone on both shoes, and what remains isnt pretty. Outer shell is half unraveled etc. etc. I got a bit of toe jamn,blisters, and the like, - but if youre gonna bomb down hills you should expect to break your feet in and not your shoes. Gooood overall, but I cant afford the price every 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: marcus

product_meta.title: La Sportiva mens Wildcat 2.0 GTX-M Wildcat 2.0 Gtx-m
product_meta.description:
* Please click here for the La Sportiva Size Conversion.
   
 * Feel the freedom of the trail right under your feet when you run with the La Sportiva® Wildcat 2.0 GTX trail running shoe in both rain and shine. 
 * A stable, neutral, and extremely well-cushioned trail running shoe with excellent waterproof protection.
 * AirMesh upper with a Trail Cage frame and TPU transkinetic heel stabilizer for stability, as well as UreTech reinforcements in high wear areas.
 * Tongue webbing for tongue control and stability.
 * One-piece high frequency molded lacing harness.
 * GORE-TEX® Extended Comfort lining is a waterproof and breathable membrane that keeps your feet comfortable in all types of conditions.
 * Compression-molded MEMlex midsole with 2.4mm LaSpEVA layer for added shock absorption.
 * Nylon-molded Flex Transfer shank gives you torsional stability and flexibility with each step.
 * Plush 2.4mm LaSpEVA lasting board.
 * FriXion® AT rubber outsole with X-Axis™ technology digs into any surface for excellent sticky grip and added cushion.
 * La Sportiva's Impact Brake System™ proprietary technology in outsole design has the lugs of the soles oriented in opposing slanted directions, increasing braking power by an average of 20% and decreasing impact forces by an average of 20%.
 * Imported.
 * Measurements:  *  Weight: 1 lb
   
   
 * Product measurements were taken using size 44.5 (US Men's 11), width D - Medium. Please note that measurements may vary by size.
 * Weight of footwear is based on a single item, not a pair.
feature_bullets: New one-piece high-frequency molded lacing harness
High cushion midsole with 2.4mm LaSpEVA layer for added shock absorption
Tongue webbing for tongue control and stability
Comfortable one piece upper with a protective wear-resistant mesh trail cage
Stretch Gore-Tex lining provides an excellent fit and waterproof protection
